sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now with me, Takumbo Silako. These are our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Balancing the books and boosting health measures, France moves to keep its economy on track by reducing its COVID isolation period, while new studies show the Omicron variant causes less lung damage. Sedans plunged into a new political crisis as Prime Minister Hamdok resigns after months of widespread pro-democracy protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: as Prime Minister Hamdok resigns after months of widespread pro-democracy protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And deciding when to die. We'll look at Austria's new law that allows terminally ill people to end their own lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: France is reducing the isolation period for fully vaccinated people who test positive for COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: From today, January 3rd, it's being cut from 10 to 7 days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: President Macron's government is the latest to reduce isolation periods in a bid to keep the economy functioning as the Omicron variant spreads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: France's National Assembly is also set to vote on changing the country's health pass into a vaccination pass. It comes after a record few days in daily new infections topping 200,000 although there was a dip in reported cases following the public holiday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In England masks are now to be worn in classrooms by secondary school pupils.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Their temporary reintroduction aims to keep schools open for face-to-face learning this coming term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: With soaring daily infections, cabinet ministers are set to review anti-Covid restrictions for England on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In Russia, the authorities in the city of St. Petersburg are introducing tougher measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: All restaurants and bars and public places in general will only be able to admit those who have a negative PCR test or a QR code proving they've been vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And in Greece, citizens are now being told to use double masks or high-protection masks to enter grocery stores and public transport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, as Omicron infections continue to rise, there is a positive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's a growing consensus among the scientific community that the highly transmissible COVID variant inflicts less damage on the lungs of those infected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Chinese real estate giant Evergrande has suspended its listing on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Over the weekend, the trouble company was ordered to demolish 39 buildings on the island of Henan within 10 days for violating urban planning laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Evergrande has been struggling to repay more than 200 billion euros in liabilities since Beijing ordered a crackdown on real estate, sector debt and consumer speculation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In recent months, the company had promised to finish 91.7 percent of its unfinished projects and deliver them to buyers in a desperate bid to salvage its debts, despite having missed the earlier payment of more than one billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Failure to pay suppliers and contractors led to sustained protests from homebuyers and investors at the group's Shenzhen headquarters in September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Evergrande's woes have had a knock-on effect throughout China's property sector, with some smaller firms also defaulting on loans and others struggling to find enough cash.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Chinese authorities say they have no intention of bailing out the organisation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Sudan's Prime Minister has announced his resignation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: This comes amid political deadlock and months of widespread pro-democracy protests following October's military coup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In an address to the nation, Abdullah Hamdok called for dialogue, to agree a national charter and to draw a roadmap to complete the transition to democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Prior to his resignation, Sudanese security forces had violently dispersed pro-democracy demonstrators, killing at least two people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Hamdok's departure comes less than two months after being reinstated as part of an agreement with the military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: During that time he failed to name a cabinet, while his resignation throws Sudan into political uncertainty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: October's coup upended Sudan's plans to move to democracy after a popular uprising forced the military to overthrow long-time autocrat Omar al-Bashir.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A large fire has completely destroyed the National Assembly building where parliamentarians

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: sit in the South African city of Cape Town.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: No casualties have been reported. A 51-year-old man is being held and questioned by authorities, according to the police. President Cyril Ramaphosa visited the scene and called it a terrible and devastating event, but praised the emergency services' hard work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: They have done a fantastic job. Had they not responded in the six minutes that they told me they responded with, I think we would be talking about the National Assembly and the Council of Houses of Province is in ashes, complete ashes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: An investigation has been opened into the blaze, which started in the early hours of Sunday in the complex's oldest wing, which was completed in 1884 and had wood-panelled rooms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Problems with the fire alarm and sprinkler systems have been reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The Parliament is not currently sitting because of the holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: A crucial week for Britain's Prince Andrew as a New York court gets ready to unseal a

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: confidential 2009 deal between the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein and a woman he allegedly trafficked to the Prince. Virginia Dufresne claims the royal sexually abused her when she was just 17.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A judge will determine on Tuesday whether the case can go ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Epstein's ex-partner, Ghislaine Maxwell, was convicted last week of federal sex trafficking charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Kenyan paleontologist Richard Leakey has died at age 77.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He was best known for his fossil finding and conservation work in his native country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Conservation group Wildlife Direct said he had a natural sense of leadership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Leakey also held a number of public service roles, including director of the National Museums of Kenya and what became the Kenyan Wildlife Service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Search teams in Colorado are still looking for two missing people among the snow-covered yet smoldering debris after last week's massive wildfire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Colorado's Governor Jared Polis tore destroyed neighborhoods in Boulder County on Sunday after he witnessed first-hand the devastation caused by the massive wildfire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Nearly 1,000 homes and other buildings have been destroyed between Denver and Boulder County. The blaze came unusually late in the year following an extremely dry autumn amid a winter devoid of snow until now. As families trudged through the snow to determine the condition of their homes, one man was brought to tears by what he saw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: You know, the kids' playground is just down the street over there and I can buy new books, I can buy new furniture, but it's really hard to build back a community and friends and a social network like that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: US President Joe Biden has declared the scenes a national disaster and has freed up federal funds to assist affected people and businesses in their recovery efforts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A new law has come into effect in Austria, allowing people who are terminally ill to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: end their own lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Euronews reporter Johannes Plaschberger has more from Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The prerequisite for assisted suicide in Austria is that the person willing to die must be of age and seriously ill in the long term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Two different doctors must then confirm this, including whether the person willing to die is at all capable of making such a decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The lethal drug will be available in pharmacies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Almost all parties have voted in favor of the so-called death decree law, except for the opposition party FPÖ, according to which it has not been clarified what will happen with the lethal drug if it is not or only partially used.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Much criticism comes from the Catholic Church, which is dominant in Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The chairman of the bishops' conference called the legal approval of assisted suicide the most serious event of the past year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The church had also announced that it would ban the new legal practice in its own hospitals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The new law was prompted by a decision of the Constitutional Court that the previous ban on assisted suicide was unconstitutional.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The government then consulted with experts on how best to prevent abuse and reduce the desire for early termination of life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For example, more money will now be made available for hospice and palliative care, because it should not be up to personal circumstances or income levels what care conditions a person finds at the end of life. Johannes Blechbecker, Euronews, Vienna. be up to personal circumstances or income levels, what care conditions a person finds at the end of life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Johannes Blechbecker, Euronews, Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Western Balkans region of Europe is facing a migration crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And no more so than in northern Macedonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ten percent of the citizens of this small nation have taken the road to exile over the past 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You can see it in the deserted streets and abandoned homes and shops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The average monthly salary is just 470 euros, and many young people prefer to work abroad for more money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Around 600,000 Macedonians now live elsewhere, leaving 1.8 million compatriots at home facing abysmal economic growth and lack of investment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It's getting really difficult. We're locked in a dysfunctional system and it's hard to rebuild some unity or to try to create something better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It's like that because there are too many injustices, dysfunctions and it's really hard to start from scratch and improve from there." Along with Albania, Kosovo, Montenegro and Serbia, North Macedonia is hoping that EU membership will reverse its fortunes. But membership's been repeatedly blocked by Greece and later Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And even if it did get in, Croatia proves it might not be the magic cure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Since joining the bloc in 2013, its population has shrunk by 10% over the past 10 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The reason once again is the migration of young people abroad for a better future. The problem is a major one because it's mainly young people who leave, people who can work and the result is an ageing population.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Zagreb is providing significant financial incentives for citizens who have migrated within the EU to return and start businesses in their homeland, but it could turn out to be wishful thinking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: France's presidency of the European Council has got off to a controversial beginning with news that the EU Commission is planning to include nuclear power in its energy transition programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The draft proposal is a long-term policy goal of Emmanuel Macron and would pave the way for member states to obtain EU funding for nuclear energy programmes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In a statement, the Commission said, taking account of scientific advice and current technological progress, as well as varying transition challenges across member states, the Commission considers there is a role for natural gas and nuclear as a means to facilitate the transition towards a predominantly renewable based future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Although carbon neutral, the inclusion of nuclear along with gas in the Commission's energy mix has been strongly criticized by environmental groups who argue it would leave a dangerous legacy for future generations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The Commission's taxonomy is a licence to greenwash, Greenpeace said in a statement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Polluting companies will be delighted to have the EU seal of approval to attract cash and keep wrecking the planet by burning fossil gas and producing radioactive waste.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Germany has long been an opponent of including nuclear power in Europe's energy transition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Only this week it closed three nuclear reactors, aiming to end all nuclear power generation by the end of this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The newly appointed environmental minister described the commission's position as a total mistake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: as a total mistake. The largest group of migrants who broke through the Lithuanian-Belarusian border at the height

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: of the latest migrant crisis have been returned to Baghdad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: 98 Iraqis were promised a one-time payment of 1,000 euros after boarding the flight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: According to the Lithuanian Ministry of Internal Affairs, all went voluntarily.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: We estimate how much it costs for us for each migrant. The basic cost of maintaining one migrant is around 11,000 euros. It is obviously more profitable for us to offer a benefit, buy a ticket or arrange a flight and have fewer challenges and other problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Since the beginning of the migration crisis, Vilnius has expelled more than 500 migrants who arrived via Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Over 3,000 remain in Lithuanian refugee centres.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: We need to start thinking what we are going to do when the term refugee centres end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: We have to talk about integration, otherwise they will try and reach other European countries. Poland, Latvia, Lithuania, followed by the EU, the US and other Western countries accused the government of Alexander Lukashenko of using illegal migrants to solve political problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Minsk and Moscow blame Europe for the crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: According to the Belarusian Red Cross, there are around 600 foreigners still hoping to get into the EU at a holding centre near the border. المؤمنين والمؤمنات والمسلمين والمسلمات Il tuo supporte passa al-alto dei pavolghi. zaščitnega prema vodnih svetov. S tem, da je Patrik Zaki, mlad egyptiški človek in italijanski univerzitni student,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: vstranjen v egyptsko prezono za 22 mesece za zgodbo o misli, želel hvaliti univerzitvom in profesorom iz svojega univerziteta v Bolognji za svojo področje.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Več kot 1000 let je vstranilo na univerzitetu Bolognji, ko je Patrik profesor odprl e-mail, da bi očistili področje letters poured in at the University of Bologna since Patrick's professors decided to open an email account to keep the support campaign alive during the Covid-19 lockdown at the beginning of 2020. What struck us in this event is the absolute spontaneity and unanimity of the feelings that Patrick was able to evoke, not only from students and professors but from all types of citizen in Italy and around the world letters came in from Italy Europe Russia USA South America throughout Patrick's detention and also when he was released from prison the last 8th of December, although still awaiting trial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Patrick, we are a group of female students and today we were so happy about the news that we decided to leave the lesson early to celebrate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We raised a toast for you, but then we felt guilty because we had the privilege to attend lessons, but then we felt guilty because we had the privilege to attend lessons, but you can't.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It may be considered as an obsolete form of communication, but the power of sending letters is still great nowadays, because it reflects the power of the many who can change things just by showing their moral support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Accused of writing an article in defense of the Coptic minority in Egypt, Patrick awaits trial on the 1st of February. In the University of Bologna, they strongly believe in his innocence and they are doing all they can to make their voice heard. Patrick is a bright and capable young man, very generous and very nice too, but that's not the point. The university had the duty and the right to demand justice for one of its students.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Patrick is an Egyptian citizen, but he's also an Italian student of the University of Bologna and a European student too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Critical thinking and freedom of thought, these values are at stake in Patrick's story and these are the values that students, professors and citizens in Bologna and Italy are defending through their letters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Luca Palamara for Euronews. Thank you.
